snippet: With many incumbents leaving because of term limits, would-be successors are already securing war chests and endorsements.
abstract: Candidates for many of New York City's major elected posts are already securing war chests and endorsements, getting a head start on fund-raising for a 2013 election season that has few incumbents running; at least 22 of 51 City Council seats, four of the five borough presidencies and the citywide positions of mayor, comptroller and public advocate are expected to be open races, leading campaigns to adopt an accelerated pace.
lead_paragraph: With many incumbents leaving because of term limits, would-be successors are already securing war chests and endorsements.

headline.seo: New York Candidates Get Early Start on Fund-Raising for 2013
headline.main: Some Candidates Get Early Start on Fund-Raising for 2013
headline.print_headline: Some Candidates Get Early Start on Fund-Raising for 2013
